Key Match Events: The benches cleared after Royals third baseman Maikel Garcia had a hard slide into second base and took an incidental forearm from Anthony Volpe while he was making the tag to finish off a double play.
Jazz Chisholm and Maikel Garcia exchanged words, leading to the dugouts and bullpens spilling onto the field.
Aaron Judge and Juan Soto were among the Yankees players stepping in between Volpe and Garcia.
Gerrit Cole walked toward Garcia before catcher Austin Wells intercepted him and held him back.
Pre-Game Insights: Jazz Chisholm Jr. put himself in the crosshairs of the ALDS by saying the Royals got 'lucky' in their Game 2 win and insisting the Yankees would still win the series.
Post-Match Reflections: Jazz Chisholm said in the champagne-drenched Yankees clubhouse after a 3-1 win at Kauffman Stadium, 'I just felt like [Garcia] tried to go injure Volpe because he was being a sore loser.'

Volpe did not seem to have an issue with Garcia’s slide, stating, 'The stakes are high. Everyone’s playing hard, everyone’s trying to win. They’re playing for their season. He went in hard, but we’re always going to stand up.'
Manager Aaron Boone said he did not know what everyone was mad about, but indicated it paled in comparison to the Yankees-Royals rivalry of old.
